medical_history.chief_complaint: 3 days of right upper quadrant abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms first began with malaise and associated nausea and vomiting that resolved, followed by the development of right sided abdominal pain. The pain is described as dull, intermittent, nonradiating, worse with activity, and not associated with meals. The patient has eaten very little since the onset and denies any further nausea or vomiting since then.
